notes: Full-size sedan on Panther platform (1992-2011). Final Mercury model. Popular with fleets and seniors. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Grand Marquis article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation midsize sedan (1996-2005). Ford Taurus twin. Discontinued 2005, revived 2008. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Sable article, January 2025 revision.
Fifth generation (2008-2009). Ford Taurus twin. Discontinued again after 2 years. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Sable article, January 2025 revision.
Eighth generation sports coupe (1999-2002). Final Mercury sports car. Based on Mondeo platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Cougar article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation midsize SUV (2002-2010). Ford Explorer twin. V8 available 2002-2005. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Mountaineer article, January 2025 revision.
First generation compact crossover (2005-2011). Ford Escape/Mazda Tribute twin. Hybrid available 2006+. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Mariner article, January 2025 revision.
First generation midsize sedan (2006-2011). Ford Fusion/Lincoln MKZ twin. CD3 platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Milan article, January 2025 revision.
Full-size sedan (2005-2007). Ford Five Hundred twin. D3 platform. Replaced by Sable. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Montego article, January 2025 revision.
